pageContext.claim: “I go around and I see the leaders of different countries, and they always say, "Congratulations on the great economic success that you're having in the United States." And we have an economy that's almost twice the size of China, and much larger than any other. And you know, if you think, we've made so much progress in the last year and a half that's put us in this position.”
pageContext.analysis: In 2017, the {U.S. economy represented} a quarter share of the global economy at $18 trillion. China is second at $11 trillion or 14.8 percent of the global economy. The American economy is not almost twice the size of China's. Plus, China's economy is growing more rapidly than America's. Lastly, it's unlikely that world leaders are congratulating Trump in this way.
